quizz_info_1: trans-4,5-epoxy-(E)-2-decenal gives blood its characteristic smell. The (2E,4S,5S)-(–)-enantiomere (here synthesized) smells 20 to 30 more times than its enantiomere. A 2014 study showed that predators were attracted by trans-4,5-epoxy-(E)-2-decenal as much as actual blood.
quizz_info_2: For more details on this synthesis, see: Tetrahedron: Asymmetry 2015, 26, 861–867. For more information about the behavioral study of predators with blood and blood odor components, see: PloS one 2014, 9, e112694.

cards.condition: Dess–Martin periodinane, CH2Cl2, 0 °C, 20 min, then rt, 1 h
Ph3P=CHCHO, benzene, 60 °C, 30 min, then rt, ovenright
